xxl.core.math.functions
Class RealFunctions

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.RealFunctions

public class RealFunctions
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some static methods useful for working with RealFunctions. Additionally, this class provides some RealFunctions used for testing and evaluating algorithms of XXL, especially for those provided by the package xxl.core.math.

See Also:
RealFunction

Field Summary

          Returns the identity function defined by f:R --> R respectively, f:double --> double.
 
Method Summary
static RealFunction distCont01()
          Returns a RealFunction modeling the distribution function G(x) = x^2 * I(x)[0,1].
static RealFunction invDistCont01()
          * Returns a function g(x) that represents the inverse of the CP01 distribution with G^{-1}(y) = \sqrt(y) * I(y)[0,1].
static RealFunction invDistCont02()
          Returns a function g(x) that represents the inverse of the CP02 distribution.
static RealFunction pdfCont01()
          * Returns a function g(x) that is required for generating samples of a random variable with the CP01 pdf.
static RealFunction pdfCont02()
          Returns a function g(x) that is required for generating samples of a random variable with the CP02 pdf.
static RealFunction pdfCP00()
          Returns a RealFunction providing f(x) = x^4 + I[0.3,1](x).
static RealFunction pdfCP01()
          Returns a pdf f:R --> R defined by
f(x) = f1(x) * ( 0 <= x <= 1/3) + f2(x) * ( 1/3 < x <= 1)
with
f1(x) = 1 + 27x^2 - 54x^3
and
f2(x) = (169/8) - 135x + (2619 x^2)/8 - (693x^3)/2 + 135x^4
.
static RealFunction pdfCP02()
          Returns a pdf f:R --> R defined by
f(x) = f1(x) * ( 0 <= x <= 0.3) + f2(x) * ( 0.3 < x < 0.6 + f3(x) * ( 0.6 <= x <= 1))
with
Thereby, f1, f2, f3 are local polynomials of degree 3 such that the overall function constitutes a pdf and contains two jumps.

Field Detail

Identity

public static final RealFunction Identity
Returns the identity function defined by f:R --> R respectively, f:double --> double.

See Also:
RealFunction
Method Detail

pdfCP00

public static RealFunction pdfCP00()
Returns a RealFunction providing f(x) = x^4 + I[0.3,1](x). This function is used for simulating studies among others in
[Qiu94]: P. Qiu, Estimation of the number of jumps of the jump regression functions, 1994
and [WC92]: J.S. Wu and C.K.Chu, Kernel type estimators of jump points and values of a regression function, 1992

Returns:
a RealFunction providing f(x) = x^4 + I[0.3,1](x).

distCont01

public static RealFunction distCont01()
Returns a RealFunction modeling the distribution function G(x) = x^2 * I(x)[0,1].

Returns:
a RealFunction modeling the distribution function G(x) = x^2 * I(x)[0,1]

pdfCont01

public static RealFunction pdfCont01()
* Returns a function g(x) that is required for generating samples of a random variable with the CP01 pdf. For f(x) defined as pdfCP01() one is able to use this pdf for generating pseudo random numbers with InversionDistributionBasedPRNG and RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG. We refer to the documentation of this classes for a detailed description how to generate random numbers following a user defined distribution. Returns a RealFunction modeling the probability density function to G(x): g(x) = 2x * I(x)[0,1].

Returns:
a RealFunction modeling the probability density function to G(x): g(x) = 2x * I(x)[0,1]

invDistCont01

public static RealFunction invDistCont01()
* Returns a function g(x) that represents the inverse of the CP01 distribution with G^{-1}(y) = \sqrt(y) * I(y)[0,1]. This permits in combination with the inversion principle the generation of pseudo random numbers of CP01 with InversionDistributionBasedPRNG and RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG. Refer to the documentation of this classes for a detailed description how to generate random numbers following a user defined distribution.

Returns:
a RealFunction modeling the inversal function of G: G^{-1}(y) = \sqrt(y) * I(y)[0,1]

pdfCP01

public static RealFunction pdfCP01()
Returns a pdf f:R --> R defined by
f(x) = f1(x) * ( 0 <= x <= 1/3) + f2(x) * ( 1/3 < x <= 1)
with
f1(x) = 1 + 27x^2 - 54x^3
and
f2(x) = (169/8) - 135x + (2619 x^2)/8 - (693x^3)/2 + 135x^4
.

Returns:
pdf

pdfCP02

public static RealFunction pdfCP02()
Returns a pdf f:R --> R defined by
f(x) = f1(x) * ( 0 <= x <= 0.3) + f2(x) * ( 0.3 < x < 0.6 + f3(x) * ( 0.6 <= x <= 1))
with
Thereby, f1, f2, f3 are local polynomials of degree 3 such that the overall function constitutes a pdf and contains two jumps. For the exact definition of the function we refer to the code.

Returns:
pdf

pdfCont02

public static RealFunction pdfCont02()
Returns a function g(x) that is required for generating samples of a random variable with the CP02 pdf. For f(x) defined as pdfCP02() one is able to use this pdf for generating pseudo random numbers with InversionDistributionBasedPRNG and RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG. We refer to the documentation of this classes for a detailed description how to generate random numbers following a user defined distribution.

Returns:
a pdf

invDistCont02

public static RealFunction invDistCont02()
Returns a function g(x) that represents the inverse of the CP02 distribution. This permits in combination with the inversion principle the generation of pseudo random numbers of CP02 with InversionDistributionBasedPRNG and RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG. Refer to the documentation of this classes for a detailed description how to generate random numbers following a user defined distribution.

Returns:
inverse of the CP02 distribution
